definition: green paper (government report proposing policies and inviting discussion)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The Green Book was an exercise, if a daft one, in utopian totalitarianism.
sentences.chinese: 綠皮書就是烏托邦式的極權主義的拙劣預演。

sentences.english: Every day at school, we would study Gaddafi’s Green Book.
sentences.chinese: 在學校的每一天，我們都會學習卡扎菲綠皮書。

sentences.english: Soon the contents of the Green Book became national slogans.
sentences.chinese: 很快，綠皮書的內容就成了國家口號。
